snippet: The tax agency said it would be looking at how companies moved money and allocated costs among Chinese operations and overseas businesses.
abstract: China's State Administration of Taxation announces review that will largely target practices used by foreign-owned companies to move money and allocate costs among Chinese operations and overseas business; review is latest in series of moves against mostly Western companies in effort to increase tax collection.
lead_paragraph: The tax agency said it would be looking at how companies moved money and allocated costs among Chinese operations and overseas businesses.

headline.main: China to Crack Down on Tax Collection From Multinational Companies
headline.print_headline: China Vows to Step Up Its Reviews on Taxes
